alert.note: Alert for Accomack; Northampton; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 03 at 2:47PM EDT until September 04 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...High risk for rip currents. * WHERE...In Maryland, the Maryland Beaches. In North Carolina, Eastern Currituck County. In Virginia, Virginia Beach...in addition to Accomack and Northampton Counties. * WHEN...Through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: Life-threatening rip currents. If caught in a rip current, remain calm. Swim in a direction following the shoreline. If tired, float or tread water until out of the rip current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help. Shore break occurs when waves break directly on the beach. It is extremely important to protect your head and neck whenever you are in breaking waves by keeping your hands in front of you at all times.
